intro: Coussapoa contorta, commonly known as the twisted coussapoa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentapetalous flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Coussapoa contorta is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
